text:
Hello all;
We have deployed our environment to push IPP (Version 4 Print Drivers) to
Windows and Mobility Print for Chromebooks with Konica Copiers (C650i). We run
Papercut Print Release. Mobility print from Papercut (Free) actually uses IPP
printing to allow Chromebooks to print. If you are to use this, there are
certain application(s) that you will need to install for full copier usage
(Holepunch, Staple, Finishing, Ect) for Windows devices. 
Konica Print Experience
https://apps.microsoft.com/detail/konica-minolta-print-experience/9MVSXWCP9WH6?hl=en-US
 
The only downfall so far with Konica V4 Print Drivers; we get occasional
gibberish print jobs (once a month) printing a couple hundred pages of garbage
if the released job is walked away from. This is NOT caused by a random HTML
print job or junk print job sent. We have not been able to pinpoint what may be
causing this issue, other than too many jobs being released at the same time
that are large causing the server to buckle and spit garbage out. 
Our print provider's solution is to:
1.) "Push" the Konica Print experience from Intune *and/or* from the driver
application (Executable 7-zipped inside of driver) from GPO then push the Konica
V4 print driver to endpoint machines.
(Not Required to push the driver; Microsoft Point-and-Print is designed for this
and also defeats the purpose.) 
2.) Fall back to Version 3 print drivers that require Administrative
Credentials. So I agree with this post, our provider has not been so helpful
with coming up with a solution for/to Konica. 
ALSO!!!
You MUST have the same Version 4 print driver for all print release copiers -
the printer will not respond to print release!!!
Example: V1.0.2 vs V1.0.3 
Thank you, 
Justin R Wilson 
Systems Administrator 
Patrick Henry Local Schools 
6-900 State Route 18 
Hamler, Ohio 43524 
Never let fear take control, it only reduces an individuals full potential

metadata.topic: RE: A Practical Guide to PrintNightmare in 2024

metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from jwilson@phpatriots.org. Learn why this is
important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Hello all;
We have deployed our environment to push IPP (Version 4 Print Drivers) to
Windows and Mobility Print for Chromebooks with Konica Copiers (C650i). We run
Papercut Print Release. Mobility print from Papercut (Free) actually uses IPP
printing to allow Chromebooks to print. If you are to use this, there are
certain application(s) that you will need to install for full copier usage
(Holepunch, Staple, Finishing, Ect) for Windows devices. 
Konica Print Experience
https://apps.microsoft.com/detail/konica-minolta-print-experience/9MVSXWCP9WH6?hl=en-US
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fapps.microsoft.com%2Fdetail%2Fkonica-minolta-print-experience%2F9MVSXWCP9WH6%3Fhl%3Den-US&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C893c145bdf8744f4185008dc27139816%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638428212325004772%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=axhlNhwbbdTVrPLUgF5BDmG79LLzUrjRLpOIoyhcI6w%3D&reserved=0] 
The only downfall so far with Konica V4 Print Drivers; we get occasional
gibberish print jobs (once a month) printing a couple hundred pages of garbage
if the released job is walked away from. This is NOT caused by a random HTML
print job or junk print job sent. We have not been able to pinpoint what may be
causing this issue, other than too many jobs being released at the same time
that are large causing the server to buckle and spit garbage out. 
Our print provider's solution is to:
1.) "Push" the Konica Print experience from Intune *and/or* from the driver
application (Executable 7-zipped inside of driver) from GPO then push the Konica
V4 print driver to endpoint machines.
(Not Required to push the driver; Microsoft Point-and-Print is designed for this
and also defeats the purpose.) 
2.) Fall back to Version 3 print drivers that require Administrative
Credentials. So I agree with this post, our provider has not been so helpful
with coming up with a solution for/to Konica. 
ALSO!!!
You MUST have the same Version 4 print driver for all print release copiers -
the printer will not respond to print release!!!
Example: V1.0.2   vs   V1.0.3 
Thank you, 
Justin R Wilson 
Systems Administrator 
Patrick Henry Local Schools 
6-900 State Route 18 
Hamler, Ohio 43524 
Never let fear take control, it only reduces an individuals full potential 
On Tue, Feb 6, 2024 at 5:03 AM Ian Murphy <ian@integra-xp.com
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/CAHiENFHewS6J37e2G8qMCkw7u_8yLLasJ%3Dav1hmw1gwyAHAaow%40mail.gmail.com
